title: Dublin Murders episode 3 review: a doppelganger death and a naked man covered in cheap wine - and we still have no clue whodunit
text:
Another dead twin. Dodgy land deals. A naked man dancing in the forest and howling at the moon. The plot thickened like mud and blood on finely crafted crime drama Dublin Murders (BBC One) but it’s still anyone’s guess who killed ballerina Katy Devlin. One might even venture that we can’t see the wood for the trees.

As Katy was laid to rest in a white coffin with blue velvet lining (not pink silk, to her mother’s chagrin), the whole of Knocknaree turned out for the funeral. In a community where everyone harbours secrets, the unsettling atmosphere in the Devlin household raised the bleak prospect that patriarch Jonathan (Peter McDonald) was abusing at least one of his daughters.

Police partners...
